summary: This document is an email chain from July 23, 2020, regarding a request for documentation related to Jeffrey Epstein. An Associate Warden at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York is responding to inquiries about documentation on Epstein, noting they have saved a large amount of material and are sending it separately. The email references a litigation hold placed after the incident the previous year (Epstein's death).

persons.name: Associate Warden MCC New York
persons.role: Associate Warden at Metropolitan Correctional Center New York
persons.context: The email sender who has saved documentation related to Jeffrey Epstein on their h:drive and is responding to a request for documentation.

events.title: Epstein incident/death at MCC
events.description: Reference to 'the incident last year' which is understood to be Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in August 2019.

events.title: Documentation request for Epstein matter
events.description: A request is made for documentation relating to Jeffrey Epstein, prompting the Associate Warden to send saved files.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: An Associate Warden at MCC New York had saved a large amount of documentation related to Jeffrey Epstein on their h:drive.
The documentation was too large to send in a single email, indicating substantial records were kept.
A litigation hold was placed on Epstein-related documentation soon after his death in August 2019.
The email is a response to a request for documentation, likely part of an investigation or inquiry.
The correspondence confirms the ongoing preservation and collection of records related to Epstein's incarceration and death.
